QAPair.Question: What is (are) Hot tub folliculitis ?
QAPair.Answer: Hot tub folliculitis is an infection of the skin around the lower part of the hair shaft (hair follicles). It usually occurs when you come into contact with certain bacteria that live in warm and wet areas.

QAPair.Question: What causes Hot tub folliculitis ?
QAPair.Answer: Hot tub folliculitis is caused by Pseudomonas aeruginosa , a bacteria that survives in hot tubs, especially tubs made of wood. The bacteria can also be found in whirlpools and swimming pools, or on contaminated water-associated objects such as gloves, towels, pool toys, or sponges.

QAPair.Question: What are the symptoms of Hot tub folliculitis ?
QAPair.Answer: The first symptom of hot tub folliculitis is an itchy, bumpy, and red rash. Symptoms can appear from several hours to 5 days after contact with the bacteria. The rash may: Turn into dark red tender nodules , Have bumps that fill with pus, Look like acne, Be thicker under swimsuit areas where the water was in contact with the skin for longer , Other people who used the hot tub may have the same rash. Some patients may feel ill or have a fever or swollen lymph nodes.

QAPair.Question: How to diagnose Hot tub folliculitis ?
QAPair.Answer: Your health care provider can often make this diagnosis based on looking at the rash and knowing that you have been in a hot tub. Sometimes a culture or Gram stain may be done to identify the bacteria.

QAPair.Question: What are the treatments for Hot tub folliculitis ?
QAPair.Answer: Treatment may not be needed. The mild form of the disease often clears on its own. Anti-itch medicines may be used to ease discomfort. In severe cases, your provider may prescribe an antibiotic.

QAPair.Question: What is the outlook for Hot tub folliculitis ?
QAPair.Answer: This condition usually clears without scarring. The problem may come back if you use the hot tub again before it has been cleaned.

QAPair.Question: What are the complications of Hot tub folliculitis ?
QAPair.Answer: In rare cases, a collection of pus ( abscess ) may form.

QAPair.Question: Do I need to see a doctor for Hot tub folliculitis ?
QAPair.Answer: Contact your provider if you develop symptoms of hot tub folliculitis.

QAPair.Question: How to prevent Hot tub folliculitis ?
QAPair.Answer: Controlling the acid levels and chlorine, bromine, or ozone content of the hot tub may help prevent the problem.
